thread.title: Most incredible wrecks in The Clash at Daytona International Speedway
thread.title_full: Most incredible wrecks in The Clash at Daytona International Speedway

author: Brian
title: Most incredible wrecks in The Clash at Daytona International Speedway
text:
Feb 13, 2017 at 4:33p ET 0Shares 
Since the inaugural Clash at Daytona International Speedway in 1979, there certainly haven't been a shortage of spectacular crashes. 
And this Saturday, Feb. 18 in the Advance Auto Parts Clash at Daytona (8 p.m. ET, FS1), we are bound to see more of the same with money and a trophy on the line. 
Here is some of the most incredible wrecks in the Clash through the years: 1983 
Bobby Allison crashes his No. 22 Buick out of the 1983 Busch Clash. RacingOne ISC Archives via Getty Images 1984 
Ricky Rudd suffered a concussion, serious damage to his ribcage, a badly swollen face and bloodshot eyes as a result of this scary flip in the Clash. Rudd raced in the Daytona 500 the very next week, and then won at Richmond two weeks later despite the injuries. RacingOne ISC Archives via Getty Images 2007 
The infield grass flies as Denny Hamlin slides through the tri-oval in front of Dale Jarrett in the 2007 exhibition race. Getty Images Getty Images for NASCAR 2009 
The 2009 exhibition race was filled with spectacular wrecks, including this one involving Kyle Busch (18), Denny Hamlin (11), AJ Allmendinger (44), Jimmie Johnson (48), and Casey Mears (07) as others try to evade the maylay. This content is subject to copyright. MCT via Getty Images 2009 
Jimmie Johnson (48) and Casey Mears (07) crash hard in the corner in 2009. Getty Images Getty Images for NASCAR 2009 
Joey Logano (20), Scott Speed (82), David Ragan (6), Robby Gordon (7) and Casey Mears (07) pile it up in the turn as Jeff Gordon (24) miraculously manages to avoid the incident. Getty Images Getty Images for NASCAR 2010 
A chain reaction left Matt Kenseth (17), Bobby Labonte (71), Carl Edwards (99) and Scott Speed (82) with wreck racecars. 2010 
The 2010 Clash wasn’t very kind to Kurt Busch, crashing his No. 2 Team Penske Dodge hard into the outside wall. This content is subject to copyright. MCT via Getty Images 2011 
Joey Logano (20), Carl Edwards (99) and Kevin Conway (97) wreck on the backstretch. Getty Images Getty Images for NASCAR 2012 
The 2012 running of the exhibition race was one wreck-filled mess. Using some stealth driving talent, Kyle Busch managed to save his No. 18 Joe Gibbs Racing Toyota after getting loose in Turn 2. 2012 
Matt Kenseth (17), Dale Earnhardt Jr. (88), Martin Truex Jr. (56), Joey Logano (20) and Kevin Harvick (29) wad it up in the corner. 2012 
Massive crash collects Matt Kenseth (17), Paul Menard (27), David Ragan (34), and Michael Waltrip (55). 2012 
With three laps remaining, Kyle Busch and Jeff Gordon were racing hard for position at the front when Gordon got into Busch in Turn 4. This sent the No. 18 out of control, but Busch was able to save his racecar. Gordon wasn’t as lucky, though. 2012 
After making contact with Busch, Gordon lost control of his No. 24 Hendrick Motorsports Chevy, hitting the Turn 4 wall and collecting Jimmie Johnson (48) and Kurt Busch (51) in the process. 2012 
Gordon’s No. 24 car slid down the track on the driver’s side before a wild series of flips on the frontstretch. 2012 
Gordon’s car (right) continues to slide down the track as Busch and Johnson try to regain control of their wrecked rides. 2012 
Sparks fly as Gordon begins a the first of a few scary-looking tumbles before coming to a hault. 2012 
Gordon’s wild ride ride ended on his roof and he was able to climb out of the car unharmed with the help of safety workers. 2013 
Some heavy-hitters were caught up in this one as Denny Hamlin (11), Jimmie Johnson (48), Kyle Busch (18) and Jeff Gordon (24) crash in Turns 1 and 2. 2014 
Running second in the 2014 exhibition race, Jimmie Johnson got loose exiting Turn 4 and slammed the inside wall hard on the driver-side of his No. 48 Chevy. NASCAR via Getty Images Sean Gardner 2014 
A cool shot as Kyle Busch’s No. 18 slides across the 31-degree back while trying to save his racecar after getting loose. Getty Images Todd Warshaw 2014 
A spectacular chain reaction on the frontstretch left Carl Edwards (99), Tony Stewart (14) Jeff Gordon (24), Kurt Busch (41) and Matt Kenseth (20) with wrecked racecars. NASCAR via Getty Images Jared C. Tilton 2014 
The entire driver-side of Danica Patrick’s No. 10 Stewart-Haas Racing Chevy was torn off after crashing in 2014. Getty Images Jonathan Ferrey 2015 
Kyle Busch (18) goes through the tri-oval grass while trying to dodge Brad Keselowski’s heavily damaged No. 2 Team Penske Ford. NASCAR NASCAR via Getty Images 2015 
Clint Bowyer (15), Kyle Busch (18), Kasey Kahne (5), Paul Menard (27), Ricky Stenhouse Jr. (17) and Tony Stewart (14) were all involved in this big incident in the tri-oval. NASCAR via Getty Images Robert Laberge 2015 
Sparks fly under the lights as Ricky Stenhouse Jr. (17) and Austin Dillon (3) crash while Kyle Larson tries to avoid them. Getty Images Sarah Glenn 2016 
Tony Stewart’s final exhibition race at Daytona didn’t end well, crashing his No. 14 Chevy hard at the entrance of Turn 1 after blowing a tire. 2016 
Another hard wreck occurred late in the 2016 race, as Martin Truex Jr. (78), Matt Kenseth (20), Jamie McMurray (1) Brad Keselowski (2), Greg Biffle (16) and Danica Patrick (10) all wreck hard in Turns 1 and 2. Getty Images Getty Images
